questionTypes.name: 内容理解（短文）- Short Passage Comprehension
questionTypes.description: Read a short passage (approx. 200 characters) and answer a single question about its content. Tests ability to grasp the main point of a simple text.
questionTypes.questionFocus: Main idea, specific detail, or author's intent.
distractorPatterns: Overly broad generalizations.
Statements that are true but not mentioned in the text.
Slightly incorrect details (e.g., wrong actor, time, or degree).
Plausible but unsupported inferences.

exampleSchema.question: 筆者が最も言いたいことは何か。

questionTypes.name: 内容理解（中文）- Medium Passage Comprehension
questionTypes.description: Read a medium-length passage (approx. 500 characters) and answer multiple questions. Tests understanding of logical flow, reasoning, and detailed information.
questionTypes.questionFocus: Causal relationships, author's reasoning, meaning of underlined phrases, specific details.
distractorPatterns: Correctly stated cause linked to the wrong effect.
Paraphrasing of the text that changes the nuance.
Answers that are only partially correct.
Confusing the author's opinion with a generally accepted idea.

questions.question: この文章の内容と合っているものはどれか。

questionTypes.name: 統合理解 - Integrated Comprehension
questionTypes.description: Read and compare two different texts (A and B) on the same topic and answer questions that require synthesizing information from both. Tests comparative and analytical skills.
questionTypes.questionFocus: Points of agreement and disagreement, information unique to one text, conclusions that can be drawn from both.
distractorPatterns: Information true for text A but presented as true for both.
A point of disagreement presented as a point of agreement.
A conclusion that is too extreme or not fully supported by both texts.
Confusing the main point of one text with the shared topic.

questions.question: AとBの両方の文章に共通する考えは何か。

questionTypes.name: 主張理解（長文）- Thematic Comprehension (Long Passage)
questionTypes.description: Read a long, often abstract or argumentative passage (approx. 900 characters) and answer questions about the author's overall argument, tone, and key ideas. Tests deep comprehension of complex texts.
questionTypes.questionFocus: Author's main assertion, underlying theme, structure of the argument, attitude towards the topic.
distractorPatterns: A supporting detail presented as the main theme.
A counter-argument mentioned by the author, presented as their own opinion.
A correct statement that doesn't capture the full nuance of the author's claim.
Misrepresenting the author's tone (e.g., critical vs. neutral).

questions.question: この文章で筆者が最も強く主張していることは何か。

questionTypes.name: 情報検索 - Information Retrieval
questionTypes.description: Scan a practical text like a poster, flyer, email, or chart to find specific pieces of information needed to answer questions. Tests practical reading and information extraction skills.
questionTypes.passageLength: Varies (e.g., a flyer, a set of instructions).
questionTypes.questionFocus: Locating specific details like dates, times, prices, conditions, or contact information based on a given scenario.
distractorPatterns: Information that is correct but applies to a different condition (e.g., price for adults vs. children).
Details that are visually prominent but irrelevant to the question.
Correct-looking numbers or words taken from the wrong section.
An answer that requires a calculation or inference when the information is explicitly stated elsewhere.

exampleSchema.context: You are looking for a class to take on a weekday evening.
exampleSchema.question: あなたに合うクラスはどれか。
